RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 77. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lb s.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ME DARLIN KATHLEEN led the way on the inside up the backstretch, saved ground around the turn and drew off in the stretch. NAIL POLISH raced off the pace on the outside early, came around the turn in the three and four path and improved position mildly in the final furlong. TIZ A COUNTRY GIRL tracked the pace setter on the outside up the backstretch, continued around the bend in the two and three path and was outkicked in the lane. TUDOR PEAK raced off the pace on the inside through the opening quarter of a mile, navigated the turn from the two path and made no bid. MRS BELL chased the leader on the inside early, dropped back while saving ground around the bend and continued to tire from there.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 60. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2 022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOHEMIA BABE saved ground around the first turn, dueled on the inside up the backstretch and around the far turn and shook clear in the stretch. LET'S GO MO raced in the two path early, dueled on the outside up the backstretch, continued to battle from the two path around the second turn and chased the winner home in the lane.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the m ain track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHRIS AND DAVE led the way while saving ground around the first turn and up the backstretch, drew off while racing in the two path around the far turn and won handily. FED CHAIR raced in the two path early, chased the leader up the backstretch, saved ground around the far bend and kept on in the lane. BAVARIA stalked the leader on the outside through the opening half mile, continued around the far turn still in the three path and weakened in the lane. PREFECT raced in the three path around the first turn, settled off the pace up the backstretch, dropped back further while saving ground around the second turn and was no threat.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 13100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 8. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEAMIALAUGH tracked the leader on the inside up the backstretch, saved ground around the bend, dueled on the inside in the stretch and edged clear late. ANOTHERWORLDINSIDE bumped with the horse to her outside leaving the gate, recovered to chase the leader through the opening stages, came around the turn in the three path, dueled on the outside in the stretch and gave way late. JACK'S LILLY bumped with the horse to her inside at the start, settled at the back of the pack early, navigated the turn from the three path and improved position in the final furlong. TILTED TIARA bumped with the horses to both sides and was shuffled back at the break, moved up on the outside to stalk the leaders headed into the turn, raced in the four path from there and was outkicked in the stretch. LA FAMILIA led the way up the backstretch, continued to show the way while racing in the two path around the turn, dueled between horses in upper stretch and weakened in the final furlong. TEACHER DRAMA raced at the back of the pack on the inside early, continued around the turn in the three path, swung wide into the stretch and was empty from there. ROSES FROM HEAVEN raced off the pace on the inside up the backstretch, came around the turn in the three and four path and made no bid.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUBY BLEU raced in the two path around the first turn, led the way up the backstretch, shook clear while saving ground around the far bend and held off a closer to the wire. STRAWBERRY TREAT reared up leaving the gate, trailed far behind the field on the rail through the opening half mile, swung out to the three path for the run around the second turn and gained ground steadily in the lane. RADIEUX tracked the pace setter on the outside through the opening half mile, continued around the far turn still in the two path and weakened in the stretch. ECONOMIC POWER raced into mild traffic while saving ground around the first turn, chased the leader on the inside up the backstretch, continued to save ground around the far bend and faded in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Strawberry Treat
ENTRY.OWNER: Z and Z Stables and Barrett Judith M

ENTRY.NAME: Radieux
ENTRY.OWNER: Mikelle Farms LLC and Morales Marilyn I

ENTRY.NAME: Ruby Bleu
ENTRY.OWNER: Premier Stable and Brown Jr Donald L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 8. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HELLO GRACIE led the way up the backstretch, saved ground around the turn and drew off in the lane. RUN LAURA RUN chased the leader on the outside through the opening quarter of a mile, navigated the turn from the two path and kept on in the stretch. HIT A HOMER HONEY settled off the pace on the inside early, raced into traffic and steadied headed into the turn, saved ground from there and improved position in the lane. HALLIGIRL brushed with the horse to her inside at the start, settled in the middle of the pack between horses for the run up the backstretch, saved ground around the bend and finished evenly. LIL H raced in the middle of the pack on the outside through the opening stages, continued around the turn in the three path and faded in the stretch. FIVE DAYS IN MAY brushed with the horse to her outside leaving the gate, trailed the field throughout, raced in the two path around the turn and was not a factor.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MASKED HEROINE `raced off the pace up the backstretch, came around the turn in the four path, began a bid passing the quarter pole and kicked clear. COSMOLOGICAL hit the gate and bumped with the horse to her outside at the start, recovered to duel up the backstretch, continued to battle from the two path around the bend and into the lane, was caught with a furlong to go and kept on from there. MADI'S TUNE bumped with the horse to her inside leaving the gate, chased the leaders early, navigated the turn from the three path, switched to the inside in upper stretch and chased on to the wire. BUSTIN WIDE OPEN trailed far behind the field up the backstretch, came around the turn in the three path and never threatened. IOANNA dueled on the inside through the opening quarter of a mile, continued to battle while saving ground around the turn and tired in the stretch.
